reference_summary:
Planeat
T. Colin Campbell  (Actor),     Caldwell Esselstyn Jr.  (Actor),     Shelley Lee Davies  (Director),     Or Shlomi  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Documentary
["Where have we gone wrong? Why has the death rate from heart disease and cancer exploded in recent times? Why are the ice caps melting, the oceans dying and the forests being cut down as we produce the food necessary to support our burgeoning populations? Against a backdrop of colorful and delicious food grown by organic farmers and prepared in the kitchens of world-famous chefs, PLANEAT for the first time brings together the ground-breaking studies of three prominent scientists who have made it their life's work to answer these questions."]
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Director': 'Shelley Lee Davies, Or Shlomi', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 3, 2012', 'Actors': 'T. Colin Campbell, Caldwell Esselstyn Jr.', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, German, Chinese', 'Studio': 'True Mind', 'Number of discs': '1'}
The interviews are very good, provide such great informative information and everyone should listen to what is being said and learn from it.
Great interviews
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jamie Payne', 'Harry Bradbeer', 'Coky Giedroyc', 'Sandra Goldbacher', 'Catherine Morshead'], 'Producers': ['Kudos Film and Production'], 'Starring': ['Dominic West', 'Romola Garai', 'Ben Whishaw'], 'Studio': ['BBC America']}
This program was a great and very interesting program. I was disappointed that the series was so short as I was just getting into and enjoying the program.
Give me more series

Great season

The location used for this series is a wonderful insight into how it was to live in England all those many years ago. Well worth watching.
Great piece of English life of yesteryear

profile:
**User Summary:**

This user maintains a strong interest in health and wellness, particularly the role of nutrition in combating diseases like heart disease and cancer. They actively consume educational content and have an appreciation for documentaries exploring significant scientific themes and societal issues. Their recent interaction reflects an interest in engaging series that offer excitement and suspense, marking a slight diversification in their preferences towards more general entertainment. They enjoy compelling narratives that beautifully depict historical contexts and highlight quality storytelling that fosters emotional connections.

They favor independently produced films and series featuring insights from reputable figures within health and wellness, showcasing a preference for high-caliber productions that thoroughly examine topics. This user demonstrates an ongoing quest for captivating content that merges entertainment with educational insights, emphasizing their inclination towards longer formats that deeply explore subjects of interest.

Key trends in their behavior include:
- A focus on health and wellness content, especially nutrition.
- Engagement with documentaries and series that showcase historical and societal narratives, with a recent interest in series that incorporate suspenseful storytelling.
- A strong appreciation for quality storytelling that evokes emotional responses in both educational and entertaining contexts.
- Preference for independently produced media from reputable creators.
- Positive reception of in-depth and educational content, expressing a desire for more captivating programming that captivates their interest.
